title: N5 Review: People, Family & Days of the Week

meta.focus: Review of Kanji, Vocabulary, and Grammar from Lessons N5.1–N5.2.

sections.title: Part 1: Conversation Check
sections.instructions: Read each conversation and select the best answer.

items.title: Conversation 1
items.context: りきぞ meets やまかわ先生 at school for the first time.

lines.jp: はじめまして。わたしはりきぞです。
はじめまして。わたしはやまかわです。先生です。よろしくおねがいします。
よろしくおねがいします。
今日は何よう日ですか。

items.question: Who is りきぞ's teacher?
items.explanation: やまかわ introduces themselves in line 2: 「わたしはやまかわです。先生です。」— confirming that やまかわ is りきぞ's teacher.

items.title: Conversation 2
items.context: すずき and りきぞ chat about their families.

lines.jp: りきぞさんの父母はどんな人ですか。
父はとてもやさしい人です。母はいちばんいい人です。
そうですか。わたしの母もとてもやさしいです。
お母さんといっしょにいますか。
はい、いっしょにいます。

items.question: How does りきぞ describe his mother?
items.explanation: りきぞ says 「母はいちばんいい人です」— his mother is the best (most good) person. He describes his father as やさしい, but his mother as いちばんいい.

items.title: Conversation 3
items.context: りきぞ and すずき talk about this week's schedule.

lines.jp: 今日は何よう日ですか。
水よう日から金よう日まで先生がいますか。
いいえ、土よう日と日よう日はいません。

items.question: On which days is the teacher NOT present?
items.explanation: すずき says 「土よう日と日よう日はいません」— the teacher is not present on Saturday (土よう日) and Sunday (日よう日).

sections.title: Part 2: Grammar Scramble
sections.instructions: Construct the sentence by clicking the words in the correct order.

items.q: My mother is a very kind person.
items.explanation: 母は sets the topic (mother). とても (very) modifies the adjective やさしい (kind). 人です completes the predicate: 'is a person.' Word order: topic → adverb → adjective → noun + copula.

items.q: Today is Monday.
items.explanation: 今日は marks 'today' as the topic. 月よう日 is the predicate (Monday). The copula です ends the sentence. This is the standard word order for stating what day of the week it is.

items.q: The teacher is here every day.
items.explanation: 先生は is the topic (the teacher). 毎日 (every day) is a time expression that can appear before or after the topic. います is used for animate beings (people). あります is for inanimate objects.

items.q: From Tuesday to Thursday I am with a friend.
items.explanation: から〜まで marks a range: 'from Tuesday to Thursday.' 友だちと means 'with a friend' — the particle と expresses accompaniment. います indicates the speaker's presence (animate).

items.q: How many friends are there?
items.explanation: 友だちは marks 'friends' as the topic. 何人 (how many people) uses the counter 人 with the question word 何, read as なんにん. います is used for animate beings (people and animals) — compare with あります for inanimate things. The sentence-final か makes it a question.

sections.title: Part 3: Reading — A Teacher's Week
sections.instructions: Read the passage and answer the questions.

passage.jp: やまかわ先生はとてもやさしい先生です。
passage.en: Teacher Yamakawa is a very kind teacher.

passage.jp: 毎日、月よう日から金よう日まで先生がいます。
passage.en: Every day, from Monday to Friday, the teacher is present.

passage.jp: 土よう日と日よう日は先生がいません。
passage.en: On Saturday and Sunday, the teacher is not present.

passage.jp: りきぞさんの友だちも先生といっしょにいます。
passage.en: Rikizo's friend is also together with the teacher.

passage.jp: 今月もたくさんの人が先生といっしょにいます。
passage.en: This month too, many people are together with the teacher.

questions.q: 先生は何よう日から何よう日までいますか。
questions.a: 月よう日から金よう日まで
choices: 月よう日から金よう日まで
火よう日から土よう日まで
水よう日から日よう日まで
questions.explanation: The passage states 月よう日から金よう日まで先生がいます — the teacher is present from Monday to Friday. Saturday and Sunday are days off.

questions.q: だれが先生といっしょにいますか。
questions.explanation: The passage says りきぞさんの友だちも先生といっしょにいます — Rikizo's friend is also together with the teacher.

questions.q: やまかわ先生はどんな先生ですか。
questions.explanation: The first sentence states やまかわ先生はとてもやさしい先生です — Teacher Yamakawa is a very kind teacher.

sections.title: Part 4: Kanji Readings
sections.instructions: Select the correct reading for the [bracketed] word.

items.q: わたしの[先生]はやまかわです。
items.explanation: 先生 is read せんせい (teacher). 先 (さき/せん) + 生 (せい). This is one of the most common compound words in Japanese.

items.q: 今日は[水よう日]です。
items.explanation: 水よう日 is read すいようび (Wednesday). The kanji 水 (water) has the on-reading すい, used in the day names.

items.q: [毎日]先生がいます。
items.explanation: 毎日 is read まいにち (every day). 毎 (まい = every) + 日 (にち = day). A common time expression.

items.q: わたしの[父]はやさしいです。
items.explanation: 父 is read ちち when referring to one's own father (humble/plain form). The polite form for someone else's father is お父さん (おとうさん).

items.q: [今月]はたのしいです。
items.explanation: 今月 is read こんげつ (this month). 今 (こん = now/this) + 月 (げつ = month, on-reading).

items.q: [友だち]といっしょにいます。
items.explanation: 友だち is read ともだち (friend). The kanji 友 has the kun-reading とも. だち is okurigana (trailing kana).

items.q: 先生は[何よう日]にいますか。
items.explanation: 何よう日 is read なんようび (what day of the week). 何 before a counter or time word is typically read なん rather than なに. This question asks which day of the week the teacher is present.

items.q: わたしの[母]はいちばんいいです。
items.explanation: 母 is read はは when referring to one's own mother. The polite form for someone else's mother is お母さん (おかあさん).

sections.title: Part 5: Context & Vocabulary
sections.instructions: Select the best word to complete the sentence.

items.q: りきぞさんの___はとてもやさしいです。(Rikizo's ___ is very kind.)
items.explanation: お母さん (mother) makes sense in context — a person can be described as やさしい (kind). ゲーム, パソコン, and テレビ are inanimate objects that cannot be やさしい.

items.q: 今日はとても___です。うれしいです。(Today I am very ___ / happy.)
items.explanation: いい (good) fits the context — the speaker says today is very good and they are happy. やさしい means 'kind' (not quite right here). たくさん (many/a lot) and いっしょ (together) are not adjectives describing feelings.

items.q: ___は人々がたくさんいます。(There are many people every day.)
items.explanation: 毎日 (every day) correctly means 'every day' — matching 'every day' in the English translation. 今月 means 'this month,' 何よう日 asks 'what day of the week,' and 友だち means 'friend.'

items.q: わたしは先生___いっしょにいます。(I am together with the teacher.)
items.explanation: The particle と expresses accompaniment: 'together with.' が marks the subject, を marks a direct object, and から means 'from.' Only と correctly conveys 'with (someone).'

sections.title: Part 6: Grammar Check
sections.instructions: Choose the correct particle or verb form to complete the sentence.

items.q: やまかわ先生___とてもやさしいです。(Teacher Yamakawa is very kind.)
items.explanation: は is the topic marker — it marks やまかわ先生 as the topic being described. が would mark the subject in a more neutral or contrastive context. を marks a direct object. の marks possession.

items.q: りきぞさん___友だちはすずきさんです。(Rikizo's friend is Suzuki.)
items.explanation: の is the possessive particle: りきぞさんの友だち means 'Rikizo's friend.' は would make the sentence awkward. も means 'also.' と means 'and/with.'

items.q: 父___母もいっしょにいます。(Father and mother are together too.)
items.explanation: と connects two nouns with the meaning 'and': 父と母 = 'father and mother.' は would only mark the topic (one noun), が marks the subject of one noun, and まで means 'until/up to.'

items.q: 火よう日___金よう日まで先生がいます。(From Tuesday to Friday, the teacher is present.)
items.explanation: The pattern 〜から〜まで means 'from ~ to ~.' から marks the starting point. まで marks the endpoint. In this sentence, 火よう日から (from Tuesday) pairs with 金よう日まで (to Friday).
